task.title: Specifying File Types For Opening In Serna

context.p: When you browse documents to open in Serna, you can filter files by type in the Open Document Dialog and the Open Document with Template Dialog . You can specify file types to be offered in these dialogs.

note.p: These files must be in an XML-based format.

info.p: To call up the Preferences Dialog, choose Tools Preferences .

step.cmd: To add a new file type above/below the selected file type, take the following steps:

substep.cmd: Click the Insert Before / Insert After button.
In the File Type Dialog, specify the filename pattern(s) and description. Click OK.

note.p: Filename patterns must be specified as wild-card values, i.e. *.<EXTENSION>. Multiple wild-card values must be separated by semicolons (e.g. *.xhtml;*.html).

step.cmd: To edit a file type, take the following steps:

substep.cmd: Select the file type and click the Edit button.
In the File Type Dialog, modify the filename pattern(s) and/or description. Click OK.

step.cmd: To delete a file type, select it and click the Delete button.
Click the Apply button to apply the settings.
Click the Close button to close the dialog.
